meaning: Kiếm sống
example: My new next-door neighbor makes a living as a car mechanic.

meaning: Dừng làm việc
example: After four hours of studying this evening, I called it a day.

meaning: Dành thời gian làm việc
example: Some workers choose to put in ten hours a day instead of eight hours.

meaning: Có kỹ năng hoặc năng lực
example: His fear of flying means that he’s definitely not cut out to be a pilot.

meaning: Non nớt, thiếu kinh nghiệm
example: The new staff is so wet behind the ears that he’ll need a lot of training.

meaning: Đăng ký tham gia cái gì
example: I signed up for a gymnastics class at the recreation center.

meaning: Ôn tập
example: As you learn new vocabulary, it’s good to brush up on it regularly.

meaning: Nộp, trình lên
example: Please hand in your homework before you leave the classroom.

meaning: Học sinh cưng
example: I think John got an A because he’s the teacher’s pet.

meaning: Bỏ, ngừng tham gia
example: Michael had to drop out of school in order to work full-time.

meaning: ìm mua hàng giá rẻ
example: The week after Christmas is the best time to hunt for bargains.

meaning: Chỉ ngắm mà không mua hàng
example: When I don’t have enough money, I love to go window-shopping

meaning: Mua tích trữ
example: Department stores always stock up on gifts before Christmas.

meaning: giảm giá
example: By buying things when they’re on sale, it’s possible to save a lot of money

meaning: Trả hàng
example: You can take back this jacket if you are not satisfied with it.

meaning: Thư giãn
example: This vacation is just the right way for me to loosen up and enjoy myself.

meaning: Cho ai đó đi nhờ xe
example: Could you give a lift to the airport next Wednesday?

meaning: Lên đường
example: We have to be there by 10 am, so we’re hitting the road early tomorrow.

meaning: Sáng sớm
example: We have to get up at the crack of dawn to get to the airport on time.

meaning: Xa xôi, hẻo lánh
example: She found the greatest restaurants that are off the beaten track.

meaning: Có kỹ năng hoặc năng lực làm gì
example: His fear of flying means that he’s definitely not cut out to be a pilot.

meaning: Bắt đầu thực hiện kế hoạch nào đó
example: We’re still trying to get this project off the ground.

idiom: Call it a day/Call it a night
meaning: Nghỉ ngơi, dừng làm việc
example: After four hours of studying this evening, I called it a day.
phonetics: kɔl ɪt ə deɪ/kɔl ɪt ə naɪt

meaning: Liên lạc với ai đó
example: The secretary will touch base with the design company tomorrow.

meaning: Non nớt, thiếu kinh nghiệm
example: The new staff is so wet behind the ears that he’ll need a lot of training.

meaning: Yêu từ cái nhìn đầu tiên
example: Jim and Sue had a very happy ending after three months of dating. It was love at first sight.

idiom: Fall head over heels in love with someone
meaning: Yêu si mê ai đó
example: He fell head over heels in love with Sarah and they got married three months after their first date.
phonetics: fɔl hɛd ˈoʊvər hilz ɪn lʌv wɪð ˈsʌmˌwʌn

meaning: Rất vui và hạnh phúc
example: Jack was on cloud nine when his girlfriend said ‘yes’ to his proposal.

meaning: Làm tổn thương ai
example: She left him later that year and broke his heart.

meaning: Buồn bã, chán nản
example: If you go to the party, don’t spoil your uncle’s evening with a long face.

meaning: Học sinh cưng
example: I think John got an A because he’s the teacher’s pet.

meaning: Vượt qua kỳ thi với điểm số cao
example: Minh passed the university entrance exam with flying colors.

meaning: Học thuộc lòng
example: I had to learn the whole book by heart to pass the history test.

meaning: Suy nghĩ rất lâu, rất nhiều cho một vấn đề nào đó
example: They asked me for fresh ideas, so I racked my brain, but couldn’t come up with anything.

idiom: Born with a silver spoon in one’s mouth
meaning: Lớn lên trong một gia đình sung túc, đủ điều kiện
example: He was born with a silver spoon in his mouth, so he has never known what hard work is.
phonetics: bɔrn wɪð ə ˈsɪlvər spun ɪn wʌnz maʊθ

meaning: Người thân trong gia đình
example: You can’t just let your own flesh and blood go to prison if there’s any way you can help.

meaning: Đặc điểm chung trong gia đình
example: Talk to your doctor about any illnesses that run in your family.

meaning: Người khác biệt trong gia đình
example: Being the black sheep of the family, I’m the only one who works as an artist, while my parents are both teachers.

idiom: Men make houses, women make homes
meaning: Đàn ông xây nhà, đàn bà xây tổ ấm
example: Folks rumored that men make houses, women make homes. So, in Viet Nam, men often work outside to earn money, while women take care of the home.
phonetics: mɛn meɪk ˈhaʊzɪz, ˈwɪmən meɪk hoʊmz

meaning: Ăn rất nhiều, rất khỏe
example: Rohit is thin as a stick yet he eats like a horse.

meaning: Rất ngon, hấp dẫn
example: The smell of oven-fresh baked pizza made my mouth water.

meaning: Làm ai đó ăn mất ngon, chán ăn.
example: Looking at the gruesome video of the chickens being slaughtered at KFC made me lose my appetite.

idiom: Have one’s cake and eat it (too)
meaning: (Được voi đòi tiên)
example: You can’t have your cake and eat it – if you want more local services, you can’t expect to pay less tax.
phonetics: həv wʌnz keɪk ənd it ɪt (tu)

idiom: Put all one’s eggs in one basket
meaning: Đặt hết nguồn lực vào 1 nơi
example: I’m applying for several jobs because I don’t really want to put all my eggs in one basket.
phonetics: pʊt ɔl wʌnz ɛɡz ɪn wʌn ˈbæskət

meaning: Rất gầy, như da bọc xương
example: By the end of her life she was nothing but skin and bones.

meaning: Giúp đỡ ai đó
example: Could you lend me a hand with these books, please?

meaning: Giữ thể diện
example: Most children have a need to save face in front of their friends.

meaning: Cố tình phớt lờ, lảng tránh ai đó
example: He was upset to find his colleagues giving him the cold shoulder.

idiom: Get off on the wrong foot
meaning: Khởi đầu một hoạt động/ mối quan hệ không tốt đẹp
example: We got off on the wrong foot the first time I met him, but that’s all forgotten now.
phonetics: ɡɛt ɔf ɑn ðə rɔŋ fʊt

meaning: Cảm thấy lo lắng và không thoải mái
example: She looked ill at ease when she had to do public speaking.

meaning: Rất ốm và gần như sắp qua đời
example: My grandpa was so ill. The doctor said he was at death’s door.

meaning: Bình yên vô sự
example: Make sure everyone is safe and sound after the earthquake.

meaning: Qua đời
example: Our neighbor is about to kick the bucket – he has some sort of kidney infection.

meaning: Cố gắng để giữ lấy tính mạng của mình
example: Mary won a desperate fight for life and went on to make a full recovery.

meaning: Cảm thấy lo lắng và không thoải mái
example: She looked ill at ease when she had to do public speaking.

meaning: Rất ốm và gần như sắp qua đời
example: My grandpa was so ill. The doctor said he was at death’s door.

meaning: Bình yên vô sự
example: Make sure everyone is safe and sound after the earthquake.

meaning: Qua đời
example: Our neighbor is about to kick the bucket – he has some sort of kidney infection.

meaning: Cố gắng để giữ lấy tính mạng của mình
example: Mary won a desperate fight for life and went on to make a full recovery.

meaning: Gióng lên hồi chuông báo động
example: Continuous natural disasters set alarm bells ringing about environmental pollution.

meaning: Có tác động tốt tới cái gì/ai
example: The change of diet has done wonders for my skin.

meaning: Hòa mình với thiên nhiên
example: I want to get back to nature but I don’t have much time for it due to my hectic schedule.

meaning: Lượng rất nhỏ
example: Banning plastic bags is just a drop in the ocean. We need to ban all single-use plastic.

meaning: Vấn đề nan giản, khó giải quyết
example: Environmental pollution is a hot potato nowadays because it is really complicated and hard to solve.

meaning: Thông cảm và hiểu cho ai đó
example: As hard as it is to live with a disability, remember that you’re not alone—a lot of other people are in your shoes, too.

meaning: Không phải việc của mình
example: It’s really none of his business what I do with the money I earn.

idiom: Be the apple of one’s eye
meaning: Được ai yêu thích
example: Tony is the apple of my eye; he’s not only handsome but also very gallant.

meaning: Cãi nhau như chó với mèo
example: My brother and I are very close in age and we used to fight like cat and dog.

idiom: Talk man to man / Have a man-to-man chat with
meaning: Nói chuyện thẳng thắn, nghiêm túc
example: I think I need to have a man-to-man chat with you about the dangers of unprotected sex.

meaning: Không có nhiều thời gian
example: But since we are mostly pressed for time in the morning, a lavish breakfast becomes an impossible idea most of the time.

meaning: Thời gian trôi nhanh
example: I can’t believe that your youngest kid is about 20 now. How ime flies.

idiom: Have a whale of a time
meaning: Có một khoảng thời gian vui vẻ
example: I hope you have a whale of a time abroad. Take care!

meaning: Thà muộn còn hơn là không bao giờ
example: I know it’s too late to say sorry but I guess better late than never.

meaning: Hoàn thành việc gì đó trước deadline hay trước khi hết giờ, đến hạn
example: He beat the clock and booked an English course before prices increased!

meaning: Không có tiền, công việc, nhà cửa
example: That old man is a down-and-out, coming over twice a week to take the leftover food.

meaning: Tiêu hoang
example: Don’t pour money down the drain by buying that low-quality computer. It’s going to break soon.

meaning: Kiếm đủ tiền để sống qua ngày
example: Many people are struggling to make ends meet because wages are failing to keep pace with rising prices.

idiom: Cost an arm and a leg
meaning: Đắt đỏ
example: It cost us an arm and a leg to get here. But it has been worth every penny and more.

meaning: Thắt lưng buộc bụng, tiết kiệm
example: Clearly, if you are spending more than your income, you’ll need to tighten your belt.

meaning: Mưa như trút nước
example: I think I’ll stay home today. It’s raining cats and dogs and I don’t want to drive.

idiom: Save money for a rainy day
meaning: Tiết kiệm tiền cho tương lai
example: Luckily she had saved some money for a rainy day.

idiom: It never rains but it pours
meaning: Những điều tốt/xấu xảy ra liên tục
example: We had nothing to do for weeks, then suddenly we have all this work to do: it never rains but it pours!

meaning: Cho dù chuyện gì xảy ra
example: He goes jogging every morning, rain or shine.

meaning: Từ chối một lời đề nghị/ lời mời
example: They wanted me to come along for the ride but I took a rain check.

meaning: Người phụ nữ ít nói
example: My mother was a woman of few words, but when she spoke it was worth listening to.

meaning: Người phụ nữ tài năng, thành công ở nhiều lĩnh vực
example: Judy paints, does photography, and writes novels. She’s a woman for all seasons.

meaning: Người phụ nữ giàu có
example: Her extravagant spending habits led everyone to believe that she was a woman of means.

meaning: Hành động độc lập, không phụ thuộc vào ai
example: Working for herself meant that she could be her own woman.

meaning: Người đàn ông/phụ nữ của nhân dân, công chúng
example: The trouble with the governor’s campaign is that she is trying to be a woman of all people.

idiom: A friend in need (is a friend indeed)
meaning: Người bạn thực sự là một người sẵn sàng giúp đỡ, đặc biệt là trong những hoàn cảnh khó khăn.
example: She stayed by me when I was depressed about my parents’ divorce, which made me believe that “a friend in need is a friend indeed.”

idiom: Get on like a house on fire
meaning: Cảm thấy thích ai đó và trở thành bạn rất nhanh
example: I went over and struck up a conversation, and we got on like a house on fire.

idiom: Birds of a feather flock together
meaning: Ngưu tầm ngưu, mã tầm mã
example: Barry and Iris are always together, they both love horse racing, it just shows that birds of a feather flock together.

meaning: Biết tường tận, hiểu rõ ai đó
example: I just think you should know a person inside out before you decide to marry them.

meaning: Quen nhau được một thời gian
example: We go back a long way, and she’s always kept in touch, always been there for me.

meaning: Không có gì đạt được 1 cách dễ dàng
example: It must be so hard to exercise for long. – Yeah, but I want to look good, and you know, no pain, no gain.

idiom: Burn the candle at both ends
meaning: Làm việc quá sức, thức khuya dậy sớm
example: She’d been burning the candle at both ends for months to prepare for her exam.

meaning: Cải thiện phong độ, hiệu suất
example: He’s going to have to pull his socks up if he wants to stay in the team.

meaning: Làm hết sức mình
example: “I didn’t realize you were decorating the whole house.” “Oh, we don’t do things by halves around here.”

meaning: Cố gắng hơn so với yêu cầu
example: He’s a nice guy, always ready to go the extra mile for his friends.

meaning: Đạt được những gì mà mình mong muốn trong một khoảng thời gian dài
example: Meeting you is a dream come true for me.

meaning: Tốt đẹp hơn những gì mình tưởng tượng
example: The project succeeded beyond our wildest dreams.

meaning: Thắng cái gì đó dễ dàng
example: We were really unprepared for our last game, and the other team won hands down.

meaning: Thuận buồm xuôi gió
example: Once I got used to the diet, it was plain sailing and I lost six kilos over a four-month period.

meaning: Thành công tốt đẹp và nhanh chóng, như có bùa phép
example: Our little arrangement worked like a charm.

meaning: Làm điều gây nguy hiểm
example: In this economic climate, union leaders who are thinking about strikes are playing with fire.

idiom: To be on the safe side
meaning: Cho chắc ăn, tránh rủi ro
example: I didn’t think it was serious but I took her to the doctor’s just to be on the safe side.

meaning: Thoát khỏi tình huống nguy hiểm
example: Seventeen school students had a close shave when a tree fell on their bus yesterday.

meaning: Thế giới cạnh tranh
example: The music industry is a dog-eat-dog world; one day you’re on top and the next, everyone forgets you.

meaning: Sân chơi công bằng
example: Given an even playing field, girls tend to do better at school than boys.
